list.name: run
list.label: Latest Run
list.query:
from(bucket: "test_runs")
  |> range(start: -30d)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "playwright_runs")
  |> keep(columns: ["run_id"])
  |> group()
  |> distinct(column: "run_id")
  |> sort(columns: ["run_id"], desc: true)
  |> limit(n: 20)
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ _value: r.run_id }))

list.name: screenshot_url
list.label: Latest Screenshot URL
list.query:
from(bucket: "test_runs")
  |> range(start: -30d)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "playwright_artifacts")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "url")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.type == "screenshot")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r.run_id == v.run)
  |> last()
  |> keep(columns: ["_value"])
  |> limit(n:1)

templating.description: Variables: select a run (top) and the latest screenshot URL will be available as $screenshot_url.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "test_runs")
  |> range(start: -30d)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "playwright_runs")
  |> pivot(rowKey:["_time"], columnKey:["_field"], valueColumn:"_value")
  |> keep(columns: ["_time","project","environment","total","passed","failed","skipped","duration_sec"])
  |> sort(columns:["_time"], desc:true)

from(bucket: "test_runs")
  |> range(start: -30d)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "playwright_runs")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "artifacts")
  |> last()

panels.title: Screenshots Preview - How to
panels.content:
Use the Latest Run dropdown (top) to pick a run. The table above shows the raw JSON with artifact URLs. To preview screenshots directly, we added a variable $screenshot_url that points to the latest screenshot for the selected run. The panel below will embed it automatically.

<img src="$screenshot_url" width="900">

Note: If $screenshot_url is empty, make sure the reporter has written artifact points (`playwright_artifacts`) for the run and that the run variable is selected.
